result.execSummary:
The defendant Valeri A Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Judgement of Conviction
C: Defendant, DOC
C: Defendant, DOC
Elements

D.A.John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Tom Johnson.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters pleas of no contest to Counts 1 and 3 of the complaint. Pleas accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty on Counts 1 and 3.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
The Court orders that sentence be withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months on each count, concurrent.
Conditions:  
- pay all costs and fees
- undergo and complete all counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by the agent, and abide by all treatment recommendations, 
- not possess or consume alcohol without written approval of the agent 
The Court will approve early discharge after one year upon agent approval, if all conditions have been successfully completed.
Appeal rights were provided.
Copy sent to WCSO/Jail Sgt
To Atty Johnson with amended bond - needs defendants signature - to be returned in 10 days

Bond amended 10/20/15 - 
Court orders no contact provision he vacated - Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with T.A. until further order. 
other conditions remain:
Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol, maintaining absolute sobriety.
